text.title: Make Paper Shred Art
text.head: Make Paper Shred Art
text.p: Paper shredders are a common home office item . Shredders provide protection against identity theft , but they can also be used to make beautiful crafts and art projects ! Put your shredder on double duty using this guide on how to make paper shredder art .
text.head: Steps
Selecting a Paper Shredder

list.item:
Pick a shredder type . The type of shredder that you have will determine the type of project that you can do .
Go for strip cut shredders for versatility . Strip cut shredders cut paper into strips . The width of the strips depends on the machine , but it is typically between 1/4 and 1/2 inches . Strip cut shredders are great for making collage art , but they are not as good for making confetti art . Most shredder art guides use strip cut machines .
Use a cross cut shredder only for projects requiring very small pieces . Cross cut shredders cut paper into small square pieces varying in size between XX and XX inches . Higher security machines make even smaller shreddings and can even turn paper into dust — such machines are not good for making shredder art . Cross cut shredders are more common than strip cut shredders , but they are not as versatile for creating art .

Consider other factors as you compare shredder models . The size and capabilities of your shredder will impact the scale of your project . Waste bin capacity , speed , run time , and multiple page capacity are all factors to consider .
The size of your shredder will help to determine the size of your project . Waste bin capacity refers to the size , in volume , of the bin that a shredder discards shredder material into . A shredder with a smaller waste bin capacity might slow you down .
Speed and run time can also slow you down . A slow shredder will take longer to shred through your material . Run time is the amount of time that a shredder can run continuously . Do not overload your shredder by running it for longer than intended .
Some shredders can only shred one page at a time , while others can shred multiple or even many pages at once . Never overload your shredder with more papers at one time than it can handle or it will jam or even break .

text.head: Selecting Paper

list.item: Create a color scheme . Decide on a color or create a color scheme for your project . If your project has a theme , such as Christmas or Halloween , you may already know what colors to use . If you do not have a preset color theme , consider color theory when selecting colors . You can also choose patterned paper , such as origami paper , to give your project an extra flair .

Choose the right weight paper . Not all shredders can handle a heavier weight paper like card-stock , and not all art projects require heavily weighted paper either . Consider the parameters for your project as well as the limitations of your machine when selecting paper .

Ensure an even mix of color in your project . When adding your paper to the machine , do not add each color all at once . Instead , add a few pieces of one color , then a few pieces of the next color , and so on in a cycle to ensure an even mix of colors in your shredder bag . Alternatively , if you would like to keep the colors separate , consider using a different shredder bag for each color so that they do not mix at all .

text.head: Making Art

list.item: Make decorative jars . Using any type of shredder , shred an even mix of colors in your color theme , and fill a jar with your shreddings . These jars can be used as centerpieces at a wedding or party , conversation pieces on a shelf , or any other way that you would like !

Make collage art . Using a strip shredder , shred an even mix of colors in your color theme , and make a collage . You can cut the strips to different lengths with scissors to further customize your art . Some ideas for collage are making a Christmas tree or a firework .

Get creative ! There are many different kinds of art projects that you can make with shreddings from your shredder : confetti , mosaics , weaving strips , and more ! There are endless possibilities . Finally , your shreddings can be useful craft materials as well . Extra shreddings can be used to package a gift , or to add zest to a gift bag . Do n’t be afraid to experiment with this fun artform .

text.head: Tips

list.item: Remember to oil your machine . A well-oiled shredder results in fewer jams .
Keep sensitive shredded material separate from your art material . You do n’t want to accidentally use a sensitive document in your art !
Use shredder bags to keep your shreddings in order .

text.head: Warnings

list.item:
Keep your fingers away from the blades
! Even if the shredder is unplugged and off , you can still get cut .
